item.title: 联合国报告显示数千名卢旺达军人在刚果作战
item.description: 联合国专家说，数以千计的卢旺达军队正在支持刚果民主共和国东部的叛乱，这场叛乱已导致数百万人流离失所，并使两国处于战争边缘。【原文：Thousands of Rwandan troops are backing a rebellion in eastern Democratic Republic of Congo that has displaced millions of people and brought the two countries to the brink of war, United Nations experts said.】

item.title: 英国和法国大选后走上不同的能源之路
item.description:
英国首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）受命推动可再生能源发展，而法国总统埃马纽埃尔-马克龙（Emmanuel Macron）则面临着一个四分五裂的联盟。【原文：

British Prime Minister Keir Starmer has a mandate to boost renewables while French President Emmanuel Macron faces a fractured coalition. 

】

item.title: 弗雷泽的离职修复者称花旗 "正走在重建之路上
item.description: 蒂蒂-科尔（Titi Cole）还有几个月就要从花旗集团退休了，简-弗雷泽（Jane Fraser）把她叫到花旗集团曼哈顿总部 38 层的一个私人座位上。【原文：Titi Cole was just months away from her long-planned retirement from Citigroup Inc. when Jane Fraser summoned her to a private seating area on the 38th floor of the firm’s Manhattan headquarters.】

item.title: 欧洲投资银行向西班牙最大的风险投资基金认捐 3.5 亿欧元
item.description: 欧洲投资银行（European Investment Bank）的风险投资部门已承诺向西班牙最大的风险投资基金提供 3.5 亿欧元（约合 3.79 亿美元）的资金；这是欧洲帮助本地公司克服投资低迷并阻止它们迁往海外的努力的一部分。【原文：The European Investment Bank’s venture capital arm has committed €350 million ($379 million) into what’s set to become Spain’s biggest venture capital fund — part of a European drive to help local companies overcome an investment slump and to stop them from relocating overseas.】

item.title: 特里谢称法国大选结果显示国家分裂
item.description:
欧洲央行前行长参加法国大选结果特别版Voternomics 。【原文：

The former ECB president joins a special edition of Voternomics on the French election results. 

】

item.title: 英国央行行长哈斯克尔称应按兵不动直至通胀消退
item.description: 英国央行政策制定者乔纳森-哈斯凯尔（Jonathan Haskel）表示，在有更多确凿证据表明通胀压力受到抑制之前，英国利率应维持在 16 年来的高位。【原文：Bank of England policy maker Jonathan Haskel said UK interest rates should stay at a 16-year high until there’s more firm evidence that inflationary pressures are subdued.】

item.title: 鲍威尔将在国会就高利率和银行规则问题面对美联储批评者
item.description: 杰罗姆-鲍威尔本周将面临来自立法者的压力，他们对美联储降息越来越不耐烦，还有一些人对美联储提高华尔街贷款机构资本要求的最新计划不满。【原文：Jerome Powell will face pressure this week from lawmakers growing impatient for the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates and others who are unhappy with its latest plan to boost capital requirements for Wall Street lenders.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事美洲
item.description: 早上好。美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）准备向立法者发表讲话，总统乔-拜登（Joe Biden）面临更多压力，交易员们为银行财报做好准备。以下是市场动态。【原文：Good morning. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell prepares to speak to lawmakers, President Joe Biden faces more pressure and traders brace for bank earnings. Here’s what’s moving markets. — Kristine Aquino】

item.title: 香港商业地产交易降至 2008 年以来最低点
item.description: 在高利率和市场疲软的背景下，香港上半年有 48 宗商业地产交易成交，是 2008 年以来成交量最低的六个月。【原文：Hong Kong saw 48 commercial property transactions close in the first half of the year, the lowest for a six-month period since 2008, amid high interest rates and weak market sentiment.】

item.title: 富裕投资者俱乐部越来越拥挤
item.description:
符合合格投资者资格的美国家庭比以往任何时候都多。资产经理们兴奋不已，但民主化也有弊端。【原文：

More US households than ever qualify as accredited investors. Asset managers are thrilled, but democratization has downsides.

】

item.title: 盈利季节开始前银行套期保值成本低廉
item.description: 摩根大通（JPMorgan Chase & Co.）、富国银行（Wells Fargo & Co.）和花旗集团（Citigroup Inc.【原文：JPMorgan Chase & Co., Wells Fargo & Co. and Citigroup Inc. are kicking off the US banks’ earnings season on Friday, and traders are feeling pretty relaxed about it.】

item.title: 波音和空中客车公司的延误导致 DAE 的维修车间出现老旧飞机
item.description: 中东最大的航空服务公司称，由于波音公司和空中客车公司推迟交付新喷气式飞机，航空公司对其维护和大修设施的需求增加，因为航空公司只能使用老旧飞机。【原文：The Middle East’s biggest aviation services firm said delayed deliveries of new jets by Boeing Co. and Airbus SE have driven up demand for its maintenance and overhaul facilities as airlines make do with older planes.】

item.title: 斯塔默将于本周启动GB能源、投资者工作组
item.description: 英国新首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）将于本周启动 "伟大的英国能源"（Great British Energy）项目，这是一家旨在刺激清洁能源投资的上市公司，他还将召集一个商业特别工作组，就建立国家财富基金提出建议，他的政府希望以此表明自己正在起步。【原文：New UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer will this week launch Great British Energy, a public company designed to spur investment in clean energy, and convene a business task force to advise on the creation of a national wealth fund, as his government looks to show it is getting off on the front foot.】

item.title: 一家能源公司即将管理 2800 万巴西人的用水
item.description: 巴西人口最多的州即将向一家价值 70 亿美元的能源分销商出售拉丁美洲最大水务公司的战略股份。【原文：Brazil’s most populous state is about to sell a strategic stake in Latin America’s largest water utility to a $7 billion energy distributor that only got its start in sanitation two years ago.】

item.title: 马士基警告南非沿岸将出现极端天气延误
item.description: A.P. Moller-Maersk A/S警告说，极端天气条件和袭击南非海岸的风暴潮预计将导致航运延误。【原文：A.P. Moller-Maersk A/S warned extreme weather conditions and a storm surge lashing the South African coast are expected to cause shipping delays.】

item.title: Tarom 取消航班，数千人滞留罗马尼亚机场
item.description: 周一，罗马尼亚国有航空公司 Tarom 以机组人员不足为由取消了约 20 个航班，包括政府官员在内的数千人滞留在布加勒斯特机场。【原文：Thousands of people, including government officials, were stranded at the Bucharest airport on Monday after Romanian state-owned air-carrier Tarom canceled about 20 flights, citing a lack of crew.】

item.title: 韩国启用新政，韩元尾盘流动性下降
item.description: 在延长交易的第一周，韩元的流动性在深夜时段有所下降，这对渴望支持市场的官员来说是一个潜在的挫折，同时也增加了在全球投资者获得更多投资机会的同时价格大幅波动的风险。【原文：Liquidity in the South Korean won dropped during late-night hours in the first week of extended trading, a potential setback for officials keen to bolster the market and heightening the risk of big price swings just as global investors gain more access.】

item.title: 美国财报旺季是股市再创新高的关键
item.description: 华尔街的一些策略师认为，美国企业需要在季度财报季实现井喷，美股才能延续破纪录的涨势。【原文：Corporate America needs to deliver a blowout quarterly earnings season for US stocks to extend a record-breaking rally, according to some Wall Street strategists.】

item.title: 股票如何成为创纪录的美国人玩的游戏
item.description:
更多的市场参与也意味着更多的风险。【原文：

More market participation also means more risk.

】

item.title: 特里谢希望在法国建立负责任的财政联盟
item.description: 欧洲中央银行前行长让-克洛德-特里谢说，他希望法国温和派政党能够联合起来组建联合政府，确保控制法国的支出计划。【原文：Former European Central Bank President Jean-Claude Trichet said he hopes that moderate French political parties will join forces to form a coalition government that will make sure to keep France’s spending plans in check.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织将讨论降低大额借款人罚金的方案
item.description: 在一些国家对利率上升导致费用变得不合理表示担忧之后，国际货币基金组织将讨论对其向最大借款国收取的费用进行审查。【原文：The International Monetary Fund is set to discuss a review of the fees it charges its biggest borrowers after some nations raised concerns that costs are becoming unreasonable due to higher interest rates.】

item.title: 匈牙利提高银行暴利税以弥补预算赤字
item.description: 匈牙利政府宣布计划通过对银行征收新税来填补预算缺口，而不是像以前承诺的那样降低对工业的暴利税。【原文：Hungary’s government announced plans to plug gaps in its budget by introducing new taxes on banks and not lowering windfall levies on industries as formerly promised.】

item.title: 加纳与债券持有人的协议获得官方债权人批准
item.description: 加纳与欧元债券持有人达成的债务重组协议已获得官方债权人委员会的批准。【原文：Ghana’s debt revamp deal with eurobond holders has won the approval of the official creditor committee.】

item.description:
沃伦-莫斯勒（Warren Mosler）谈高债务水平、巨额赤字和正统货币政策令人不安的组合。【原文：

Warren Mosler on the troubling mix of high debt levels, large deficits, and orthodox monetary policy.

item.title: 飓风贝里尔逼近得克萨斯州，欧洲天然气价格上涨
item.description: 在亚洲部分地区天气炎热以及飓风逼近主要燃料供应国得克萨斯州之际，交易商对供应风险进行了评估，欧洲天然气价格走高。【原文：European natural gas prices edged higher as traders assessed supply risks amid hot weather in parts of Asia and a hurricane approaching key fuel supplier Texas.】

item.title: 左翼意外赢得大选后法国股市下挫
item.description: 左翼联盟的意外获胜引发了人们的担忧，即进一步放松财政政策的可能性增大，这意味着将给法国本已紧张的财政带来压力，法国股市因此下跌。【原文：French stocks dipped as a surprise victory for the left-wing alliance triggered worries that the higher likelihood of further fiscal easing means it would put pressure on the country’s already-strained finances.】

item.title: 印度债券流入量连续第二周因指数纳入而降温
item.description: 随着印度主权债券加入一个重要的全球指数，对印度主权债券的海外投资连续第二周放缓。【原文：Overseas investments into India’s sovereign bonds slowed for a second straight week as India’s sovereign bonds joined a key global index.】

item.title: 巴基斯坦证券交易所大楼发生火灾后停止交易
item.description: 周一上午，卡拉奇主楼发生火灾，巴基斯坦证券交易所停止交易两小时。【原文：Pakistan Stock Exchange halted trading for two hours after a fire broke out at the main building in Karachi on Monday morning.】

item.title: Grifols 称创始家族和布鲁克菲尔德正在考虑收购要约
item.description: Grifols SA 表示，其创始家族和资产管理公司布鲁克菲尔德（Brookfield）已就收购该公司并将其除名一事进行了接触，此前这家制药生产商在做空者的攻击下损失了数十亿美元的市值。【原文：Grifols SA said that its founding family and asset manager Brookfield have made an approach to buy and delist it, after the pharmaceutical producer lost billions in market value amid a short-seller attack.】
